featured.text: The same strategy for docking a vessel during an incoming tide may not work during an outgoing tide.
Hundreds of ships sailing the Spice Route docked here, bringing spices and goods for transaction, and Zanzibar became one of the biggest trading centers in the world.
Without the services of a marine pilot, docking ships would be hazardous.

definition.en_def: A structure where ships are moored or loaded and unloaded.
definition.example: The cargo ship arrived at the dock early in the morning.
